name: Path T
title: Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include a Tis or TX category for melanoma of mucosa of head and neck sites. Tis and TX are mapped to NA and TNM stage group is derived as NA.

**Note 2:**  TNM does not include a T1 or T2 category for mucosal melanoma of head and neck sites.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available.
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial noninvasive

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record

Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa 
(mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of supraglottis: 
    Supraglottis (one subsite):
        Aryepiglottic fold
        Arytenoid cartilage:

        Epilarynx, NOS

            Ventricular cavity

        Infrahyoid epiglottis
        Laryngeal cartilage, NOS
        Laryngeal (posterior) surface of epiglottis
        Suprahyoid epiglottis (including tip, lingual {anterior} and laryngeal surfaces)
WITH normal vocal cord mobility

Extension involving mucosa only of more than one subsite of supraglottis listed in code 105 
WITHOUT impaired vocal cord mobility or fixation of larynx or NOS

    Medial wall of pyriform sinus
WITHOUT impaired vocal cord mobility or fixation of larynx or NOS

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

or overlying skin

Involvement of any structures in T3 WITH impaired vocal cord mobility
Involvement of any structures in supraglottic larynx  larynx, and subglottic larynx 
WITH vocal cord fixation
Involvement of any structures in T3 plus mucosal involvement of any structure in code 305
Involvement of deep tissue of any structure in T3
Involvement of any structure in T3 WITH impaired vocal cord mobility

Minor thyroid cartilage erosion (inner cortex)  WITHOUT vocal cord fixation

    Deep tissues or musculature:
        Base of tongue

    Hypopharynx, NOS

    Pyriform sinus. NOS
WITH or WITHOUT vocal cord fixation
